page.title: 1990 Georgia Tech Yellow Jackets football team

revisions.rev:
{{NCAATeamSeason | Year = 1990 | Team = Georgia Tech Yellow Jackets | Mode = football | Image = Georgia Tech Outline Interlocking logo.svg | Conference = Atlantic Coast Conference | ShortConference = ACC | Division = | CoachRank = 1 | APRank = 2 | Record = 11-0-1 | ConfRecord = | HeadCoach = [[Bobby Ross]] | OffCoach = [[Ralph Friedgen]] | DefCoach = [[George O'Leary]] | OScheme = [[Pro Style]] | DScheme = [[4-3]] | StadiumArena = [[Bobby Dodd Stadium|Bobby Dodd Stadium at Historic Grant Field]] | Champion = National Champions
ACC Champions
Florida Citrus Bowl Champions | BowlTourney = {{alternate links|1991 Florida Citrus Bowl|Florida Citrus Bowl|title=Florida Citrus Bowl}} | BowlTourneyResult = W 45-21 vs. [[1990 Nebraska Cornhuskers football team|Nebraska]] }} {{1990 ACC football standings}} [[Image:1990 upi cropped.jpg|right|thumb|150px|1990 [[AFCA National Championship Trophy]] Georgia Tech received.]] The '''1990 Georgia Tech Yellow Jackets football team''' represented the [[Georgia Institute of Technology]] in the [[1990 NCAA Division I-A football season]]. The Yellow Jackets offense scored 379 points while the defense allowed 186 points. Led by head coach Bobby Ross, the Yellow Jackets participated in the Florida Citrus Bowl. With a nationally televised win over #1 [[1990 Virginia Cavaliers football team|Virginia]] on the road, defeating archrival Georgia for the second consecutive year, and a final mark of defeating Nebraska 45-21 in the [[1991 Florida Citrus Bowl]], Coach Bobby Ross and the Yellow Jackets were awarded a split National Championship, winning the 1990 UPI [[NCAA Division I FBS National Football Championship|National Championship]] by one vote over [[1990 Colorado Buffaloes football team|Colorado]], who won the AP poll.Clarke, Michael. [http://web.archive.org/web/20070929133414/http://www.nique.net/issues/2005-09-16/sports/5 Football program builds on strong history]. [[The Technique]]. 16 September 2005. Retrieved 1 September 2011. ==Regular season== {{main|Toe meets leather}} The most notable victory for the Yellow Jackets came on November 3 against #1 ranked [[1990 Virginia Cavaliers football team|Virginia]] at [[Scott Stadium]]. The game was televised nationally by CBS with [[Jim Nantz]] handling play-by-play duties. Georgia Tech won 41-38 thanks to a 37 yard field goal by Scott Sisson with 7 seconds remaining.{{cite web | url=http://ramblinwreck.cstv.com/sports/m-footbl/spec-rel/092107aaa.html | title=The Brawl For It All | publisher=Georgia Tech Athletic Association | date=2007-09-21 | accessdate=2009-10-07 }} Georgia Tech ended the season 11-0-1, with the lone tie coming against North Carolina. The team won the [[Coaches' Poll]] by a vote of 847-846 over [[1990 Colorado Buffaloes football team|Colorado]].Stone, Gene. [http://news.google.com/newspapers?id=4qkfAAAAIBAJ&sjid=ndYEAAAAIBAJ&pg=3124,279585&dq=1990+coaches+football+poll&hl=en Tech scores split decision, is voted No. 1 by Coaches]. [[Gadsden Times]]. 3 January 1991.
